qas.question: What are the three levels of higher learning in Estonia?
What medical fields have their bachelor's and master's levels combined into one unit?

answers.text: basic medical studies, veterinary, pharmacy, dentistry

qas.question: What do Estonian public universities have more of than higher education institutions?
What is the largest private university in Estonia?

context: Academic higher education in Estonia is divided into three levels: <a0_0>bachelor's, master's, and doctoral studies<a0_0/>. In some specialties (<a1_0>basic medical studies, veterinary, pharmacy, dentistry<a1_0/>, architect-engineer, and a classroom teacher programme) the bachelor's and master's levels are integrated into one unit. Estonian public universities have significantly more <a2_0>autonomy<a2_0/> than applied higher education institutions. In addition to organising the academic life of the university, universities can create new curricula, establish admission terms and conditions, approve the budget, approve the development plan, elect the rector, and make restricted decisions in matters concerning assets. Estonia has a moderate number of public and private universities. The largest public universities are the University of Tartu, Tallinn University of Technology, Tallinn University, Estonian University of Life Sciences, Estonian Academy of Arts; the largest private university is <a3_0>Estonian Business School<a3_0/>.
